description: From Ancient Greek συνοικισμός (sunoikismós), from συνοικίζειν (sunoikízein, “to make live with, to unite under one city”), from σύν (sún, “together”) + οἰκίζειν (oikízein, “to colonise”).

entries.meaning: (Ancient Greece) The unification of towns, tribes etc. under one capital city or polis.
examples: They always remained separate states and were never synoikised.
